questions.text: We all knew him as Dan Fielding, but he had a real name. What was this silly real name?
questions.explanation:
Reinhold.

	Coincidentally, this was the first name of the producer of the show!

questions.text: Bull also had a funny real name. After what individual of history was he named?
Speaking of Bull....what was his catch word or phrase?
questions.explanation:
Oooooo-kay!.

	They always tried to fit one ooooooo-kay somewhere in each episode.

questions.text: Prior to the arrival of Roz on the show, two other women played bailiffs alongside Bull. Give the *first* name of either of them.
questions.correct: Florence & Selma & Selma Diamond & Selma Hacker & Florence Halop & Florence Kleiner & Flo
questions.explanation:
Florence & Selma & Selma Diamond & Selma Hacker & Florence Halop & Florence Kleiner & Flo.

	Sadly, both Florence Halop and Selma Diamond, the actresses who played 'Florence' and 'Selma', respectively, died during the run of the series.

questions.text: What is the hobby of both the character Judge Harold T. Stone and the actor Harry Anderson?
questions.explanation:
Magic.

	He was (and still is) a geek, but he was 'our' geek!

questions.text: Speaking of Harry, which of the following items could *not* be found in his office?
questions.explanation:
Giant bean bag.

	As everyone knows, Harry loved Mel Torme!

questions.text: Mack married a woman who he had met while serving in Vietnam. What was her name?
What friend of Harry's favorite line was....'but I'm feeling much better now'?
questions.explanation:
Buddy.

	Buddy Ryan, played by John Astin (Gomez Addams, on the Addams family), also ended up revealing that he was Harry's father.

questions.text: On what network did Night Court make its television run?
questions.explanation:
NBC.

	Night Court was part of NBC's powerful Thursday night line-up that included the Cosby Show, Family Ties and Cheers....can you say ratings monster?

questions.text: What was the name of the down-on-his-luck homeless guy that Dan used and abused during the show?
questions.explanation:
Phil.

	Phil ended up becoming a millionaire and then dying. The actor, William Utay, continued on the show as Phil's evil brother Will.
